"Rise and shine, Mr. Kerman, rise and shine..."

I think most of you have ever played "Half Life 2" and remember Alliance Strider:

It has very interesting and cool design, so I decided to make a replica:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

That thing's fully stock, so it can't move. So I'll be glad if someone will be able to make it move with help of mods like Infernal Robotics or something like that.

Here you can download craft file: https://www./folder/a1qb5b531lhtf/Half_Life_2
as a HL2 fan this is awesome:D
Holy... this thing is awesome, dude! Nice attention to detail.
hmmm, i think you'd need a reaction wheel at least for robotics, because moving it with three legs would be awkward.

hmmm, i think you'd need a reaction wheel at least for robotics, because moving it with three legs would be awkward.

Well, I don't use any InfernalRobotics-like mods, so it was no need in reaction wheel (RW), but it has enough free space in its "head" for RW

Nice, but it doesn't walk...

I can't handle with infernal robotics, sorry) But I'll be glad if anyone will make it walk

I can see how to make it walk, except every leg would have to move individually. I might give it a try but Ill probably get to stressed out to finish it

Edited September 19, 2014 by freakazoid13

I had a look and it's 22 tons on improbably long weak legs, it looks like you'd need to move each leg reasonably quickly to get the foot back down before it falls which makes other complications with instant on/off joints. I don't think it'll move quite like it does in HL2, maybe with some creative part switching to loose some weight and go to Minmus where the gravity is lower.
Im more of a HL1 fan other than a HL2 fan, other than that, its quite awesome! Its a shame it doesn't walk, i have to say, making a funcional and nice-looking walker isn't easy.
